title: The 1% Approach to Success with Fibromyalgia

content: As we enter 2024, it’s that time of the year to set your New Year's resolutions! But how do you set realistic goals with chronic illness? How do you balance the ambition you feel on some days, along with the setbacks that fibromyalgia causes?

The reality of living with fibromyalgia is your symptoms will likely interfere with your goals. Setbacks in your health and goals are expected with a life of chronic illness. Recently, I learned of the 1% theory, which seemed like the least overwhelming approach to achieving goals.

If you can just consistently give 1% each day, over a year, you will make significant progress. It made me realize that, when living with chronic illness, this is already the way we live our lives. Some days our spoons run out early and we only have the 1% to give, and some days we have a lot more energy to spare. Slowly but surely, we make ends meet with what we have.

content: This philosophy of setting goals is already ingrained in us as chronic illness warriors. So you might as well set the big goals, right? Why hold back? Of course, you take care of your body and manage your chronic illness, but that doesn’t mean you need to restrict your ambition. Small-mindedness is not a symptom of our chronic illness, it’s quite the opposite.

Living with chronic illness, we have been exposed to a very different world than others from a young age. We learned how to constantly adapt to a world that isn’t built for chronic illness and to find endless opportunities for ourselves. After living with fibromyalgia for over a decade, you learn to constantly redesign a new life with it.

Since the age of 14, I have used my ambition to re-create the world around me to support my future with fibromyalgia, consistently striving to reach a fulfilling life with my chronic illness.  Some days I lived within my limitations, and sometimes I pushed them. So why not set big goals? We deserve the opportunity to dream big, aim high, and have fun in the process.

content: Your life doesn't stop with this diagnosis. Before you know it, it’ll be 2025. The time will pass anyway, and focusing on small progress every day will make all the difference. You’ll look back at the 1% you gave every day and realize you have formed a year of habits that just took a little ambition and belief. Another step toward owning your narrative and your life!
